docs.lead_paragraph: It felt at times as if the candidates were no longer living in a fact-based world.

headline.main: Crazy Talk at the Republican Debate

docs.abstract: Editorial assails participants in second Republican presidential debate for presenting ludicrous ideas demonstrating their inadequacy to lead United States; holds candidates spewed forth bizarre opinions on immigration, foreign policy and health while avoiding several pressing issues; contends debate presents frightening prospect for country.
docs.snippet: It felt at times as if the candidates were no longer living in a fact-based world.

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court ruled Thursday that President Barack Obama's health care law unjustly burdens religiously affiliated employers by forcing them to help provide insurance coverage for certain contraceptives, even though they can opt out of directly paying for it.

docs.lead_paragraph: The number of people without health insurance dropped last year by 8.8 million, to a total of 33 million, the Obama administration said Wednesday.

headline.main: Health Care Gains, but Income Remains Stagnant, the White House Reports
headline.print_headline: Health Care Gains, but Income Remains Stagnant, the White House Reports

docs.abstract: Census Bureau reports around 46.7 million Americans were in poverty in 2014 and poverty rate, currently at 14.8 percent, did not improve for fourth consecutive year in row; report also shows almost nine million people gained health insurance; numbers taken together indicate economic recovery has yet to benefit many Americans, although Affordable Care Act appears to be working.
docs.snippet: The number of people without health insurance dropped last year by 8.8 million, to a total of 33 million, the Obama administration said Wednesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Canada's Fairfax Financial Holdings is to invest 70 million euros (51 million pounds) in Ireland's FBD Holdings in the form of a convertible bond to bolster the general insurer's capital, the companies said on Wednesday.
